messages.content: ComfyUI_pytorch_openpose is a custom node in ComfyUI that utilizes PyTorch to run OpenPose algorithm. It allows for the detection and real-time estimation of the human pose using a single webcam feed.
What are the components involved in ComfyUI_pytorch_openpose?
The main components are body_pose_model.pth and hand_pose_model.pth. These are the pre-trained models provided for detecting human body pose and hand pose respectively.

To install, you need to follow the steps: 1. Clone the repository into the custom_nodes folder, and 2. Download the model files and place them in the models folder, then use the ComfyUI_pytorch_openpose under Hzzone>pytorch_openpose menu.
Which model files are required for installation?
The required model files are body_pose_model.pth and hand_pose_model.pth, which can be downloaded from various sources provided.
To use ComfyUI_pytorch_openpose, simply add it under the Hzzone>pytorch_openpose menu, and it will run the OpenPose algorithm on the webcam feed, providing human body and hand pose estimations.
